column2: Will Grayson is a novel by John Green and David Levithan
column3: published in April 2010 by Dutton Juvenile. The book's narrative is divided evenly between two boys named Will Grayson
column4: with Green having written all of the chapters for one and Levithan having written the chapters for the other
column5: presented in an alternating chapter fashion. One boy is referred to with capitalized letter at the start of his name
column6: while the other is referred to in all lower case letters.[2][3] The novel debuted on The New York Times children's best-seller list after its release and remained there for three weeks. It was the first LGBT-themed young adult novel to make it to that list.[4][5][6]
